intro: Plerandra crassipes, commonly known as the broad-leaved arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its inflorescence composed of a spadix and a spathe. The plant produces large, heart-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its rhizomes are edible and have been utilized as a starch source. Plerandra crassipes thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
